The first 2 hours were some of the biggest and best geek out moments in movie history. The last 20 were just as epic, just not the warm and fuzzy we are use to from a marvel movie

I have never written a review for a movie before but this movie, unexpectedly I might say, compelled me to create an account. I am a lover of Marvel and super heroes and I know a good bit about the previous story arcs (in the MCU cinematic universe and from comics), and I KNOW that for people with little to no knowledge of this movie franchise it simply won't be grabbing. However, I think this movie is one of those few superhero movies that transcends what it means to be a superhero movie. Spoilers, obviously, but Thanos's objective is to relieve the universe of the pressure it faces by eliminating half of all life in it.  How can one help but compare that to todays world? Earth faces pressure from extreme overpopulation. Wether or not you sympathize with Thanos and wether or not you would, philosophically and hypothetically, make the same decision as him, the emotional resonance was strong for me because it had real world relevance. As a stand alone story, it is unquestionably weak, but when a superhero movie can make a viewer question the mortality of mankind as a whole, I call it successful. I will pay to see this movie twice!

Avengers: Infinity War gives you a lot to think about. All about life, death and a villain who doesn't only want power, but wants a greater good. Besides it being a bit much and very overwhelming, this stunning captures emotions in a beautiful, sorrowful way.
